DataElement.preferredName: Terminal Complement Activation Soluble Complement C5b-9 Measurement Greater Than Normal Reference Range Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator of whether the Terminal complement activation of Plasma sC5b-9 is greater than the normal reference range.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Terminal Complement Activation Soluble Complement C5b-9 Measurement Greater Than Normal Reference Range Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Being or situated at an end; occurring at or forming an end._Any physiologic process in which a protease directs the cleavage of complement components C4, C2, or factor B which then form the C3 and C5 convertases for the classical and lectin pathways, respectively. This process is involved in direct lysis of target cells, immune adherence and phagocytosis of pathogens, and recruitment and activation of immunocompetent cells._The determination of the amount of soluble complement C5b-9 present in a sample._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status._Reported values within the typical or expected range._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Terminal Complement Activation Soluble Complement C5b-9 Measurement
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Being or situated at an end; occurring at or forming an end.:Any physiologic process in which a protease directs the cleavage of complement components C4, C2, or factor B which then form the C3 and C5 convertases for the classical and lectin pathways, respectively. This process is involved in direct lysis of target cells, immune adherence and phagocytosis of pathogens, and recruitment and activation of immunocompetent cells.:The determination of the amount of soluble complement C5b-9 present in a sample.

Concepts.definition: Being or situated at an end; occurring at or forming an end.

Any physiologic process in which a protease directs the cleavage of complement components C4, C2, or factor B which then form the C3 and C5 convertases for the classical and lectin pathways, respectively. This process is involved in direct lysis of target cells, immune adherence and phagocytosis of pathogens, and recruitment and activation of immunocompetent cells.
The determination of the amount of soluble complement C5b-9 present in a sample.
